Child.name: dynasty_member
Child.doc: Iterate through all dynasty members

Child.name: house_member
Child.doc: Iterate through all house members

Child.name: faith
Child.doc: Iterate through all faiths within a religion

Child.name: scheme_agent
Child.doc: Iterate through all agents in the scheme

Child.name: claimant
Child.doc: Iterate through all claimants to title. parameters: explicit = yes/no/all - default yes

Child.name: connected_county
Child.doc: Iterate through all counties connected to this one. Is based on top liege

Child.name: county_province
Child.doc: Iterate through all provinces in a county

Child.name: de_jure_county_holder
Child.doc: Iterate through all characters directly holding counties within this dejure title

Child.name: de_jure_top_liege
Child.doc: Iterate through all top lieges of the counts within this dejure title

Child.name: dejure_vassal_title_holder
Child.doc: Iterate through all the vassal holders of the title

Child.name: election_candidate
Child.doc: Iterate through all characters who are valid candidates in an election for a title

Child.name: elector
Child.doc: Iterate through all characters who are valid electors in an election for a title

Child.name: in_de_facto_hierarchy
Child.doc: Iterate through the title itself, all de facto vassals, and below. The continue trigger specifies whether to recursively iterate through the vassal's vassal

Child.name: in_de_jure_hierarchy
Child.doc: Iterate through the title itself, all de jure vassals, and below. The continue trigger specifies whether to recursively iterate through the vassal's vassal

Child.name: neighboring_county
Child.doc: Iterate through all neighboring counties. Can only be used in county scope

Child.name: this_title_or_de_jure_above
Child.doc: Iterate through this title and all its dejure liege titles

Child.name: title_heir
Child.doc: Line of succession for the scoped title

Child.name: title_joined_faction
Child.doc: Iterate through all factions joined the scope landed title

Child.name: title_to_title_neighboring_and_across_water_barony
Child.doc: Scopes from a title to a neighboring barony (incl. across water, looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: title_to_title_neighboring_and_across_water_county
Child.doc: Scopes from a title to a neighboring county (incl. across water, looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: title_to_title_neighboring_and_across_water_duchy
Child.doc: Scopes from a title to a neighboring duchy (incl. across water, looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: title_to_title_neighboring_and_across_water_empire
Child.doc: Scopes from a title to a neighboring empire (incl. across water, looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: title_to_title_neighboring_and_across_water_kingdom
Child.doc: Scopes from a title to a neighboring kingdom (incl. across water, looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: title_to_title_neighboring_barony
Child.doc: Scopes from a title to a neighboring barony (looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: title_to_title_neighboring_county
Child.doc: Scopes from a title to a neighboring county (looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: title_to_title_neighboring_duchy
Child.doc: Scopes from a title to a neighboring duchy (looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: title_to_title_neighboring_empire
Child.doc: Scopes from a title to a neighboring empire (looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: title_to_title_neighboring_kingdom
Child.doc: Scopes from a title to a neighboring kingdom (looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: alert_creatable_title
Child.doc: Iterate through all titles that can be created by the character. (only for alerts)

Child.name: alert_usurpable_title
Child.doc: Iterate through all titles that can be usurped by the character. (only for alerts)

Child.name: ally
Child.doc: Iterate through all allies

Child.name: ancestor
Child.doc: Iterate through all the ancestors of the scope character up to 5 generations

Child.name: army
Child.doc: Iterate through all armies

Child.name: character_to_title_neighboring_and_across_water_barony
Child.doc: Scopes from a character to a neighboring barony (incl. across water, looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: character_to_title_neighboring_and_across_water_county
Child.doc: Scopes from a character to a neighboring county (incl. across water, looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: character_to_title_neighboring_and_across_water_duchy
Child.doc: Scopes from a character to a neighboring duchy (incl. across water, looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: character_to_title_neighboring_and_across_water_empire
Child.doc: Scopes from a character to a neighboring empire (incl. across water, looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: character_to_title_neighboring_and_across_water_kingdom
Child.doc: Scopes from a character to a neighboring kingdom (incl. across water, looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: character_to_title_neighboring_barony
Child.doc: Scopes from a character to a neighboring barony (looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: character_to_title_neighboring_county
Child.doc: Scopes from a character to a neighboring county (looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: character_to_title_neighboring_duchy
Child.doc: Scopes from a character to a neighboring duchy (looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: character_to_title_neighboring_empire
Child.doc: Scopes from a character to a neighboring empire (looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: character_to_title_neighboring_kingdom
Child.doc: Scopes from a character to a neighboring kingdom (looking trough the de Jure lieges)

Child.name: character_war
Child.doc: Wars of the scoped character

Child.name: child
Child.doc: Iterate through all children

Child.name: claim
Child.doc: Iterate through the titles of all claims held by a character; parameters: explicit = yes/no/all pressed = yes/no/all

Child.name: close_family_member
Child.doc: Iterate through all the close family [father, mother, siblings, children, grandparents]

Child.name: close_or_extended_family_member
Child.doc: Iterate through all the close and extended relatives [father, mother, siblings, children, grandparents, uncles/aunts, nephew/niece, cousins]

Child.name: concubine
Child.doc: Iterate through all concubines

Child.name: consort
Child.doc: Iterate through all consorts (concubines and spouses)

Child.name: councillor
Child.doc: Iterate through all councillors

Child.name: courtier
Child.doc: Iterate through all courtiers

Child.name: courtier_away
Child.doc: Iterate through all courtiers that are away

Child.name: courtier_or_guest
Child.doc: Iterate through all courtiers and guests (pool and foreign court guests)

Child.name: de_jure_claim
Child.doc: Iterate through all de jure claims for a character

Child.name: diplomacy_councillor
Child.doc: Iterate through all diplomacy-based councillors

Child.name: directly_owned_province
Child.doc: Iterate through all directly owned provinces

Child.name: election_title
Child.doc: Iterate through all titles the scoped character can vote on

Child.name: extended_family_member
Child.doc: Iterate through all the extended family [uncles/aunts, nephew/niece, cousins]

Child.name: foreign_court_guest
Child.doc: Iterate through all guests visiting from another court (in contrast to pool_guest they have a liege)

Child.name: former_concubine
Child.doc: Iterate through all former concubines. Not persisted past death

Child.name: former_concubinist
Child.doc: Iterate through all former concubinists. Not persisted past death

Child.name: former_spouse
Child.doc: Iterate through all former spouses

Child.name: general_councillor
Child.doc: Iterate through all councillors that are not related to a skill

Child.name: heir
Child.doc: Heirs of the scoped character

Child.name: heir_title
Child.doc: Iterate through all landed titles character is heir to

Child.name: heir_to_title
Child.doc: Iterate through all titles the scoped character is heir to

Child.name: held_title
Child.doc: Iterate through all held landed titles

Child.name: hired_mercenary
Child.doc: Iterate through all hired mercenary companies

Child.name: hooked_character
Child.doc: Iterate through all characters this character has a hook on

Child.name: hostile_raider
Child.doc: Iterate through anyone the character is hostile to due to their top-liege's realm having been raided

Child.name: intrigue_councillor
Child.doc: Iterate through all intrigue-based councillors

Child.name: knight
Child.doc: Iterate through all knights

Child.name: known_secret
Child.doc: Iterate through all secrets known by the character

Child.name: learning_councillor
Child.doc: Iterate through all learning-based councillors

Child.name: liege_or_above
Child.doc: Iterate through all lieges above a character (skipping the character themselves)

Child.name: martial_councillor
Child.doc: Iterate through all martial-based councillors

Child.name: neighboring_and_across_water_realm_same_rank_owner
Child.doc: A sub-realm or realm bordering the scope character's realm (including across water) and has the same rank as the scope character (look for lieges of he owner of the land if necessary)

Child.name: neighboring_and_across_water_top_liege_realm
Child.doc: A realm with a different top liege neighboring the realm of the scope character's top liege (including across water); switches to the realm's top title. Can be based on borders a day or two out of date

Child.name: neighboring_and_across_water_top_liege_realm_owner
Child.doc: A realm with a different top liege neighboring the realm of the scope character's top liege (including across water); switches to the holder of the realm. Can be based on borders a day or two out of date

Child.name: neighboring_realm_same_rank_owner
Child.doc: A sub-realm or realm bordering the scope character's realm and has the same rank as the scope character (look for lieges of he owner of the land if necessary)

Child.name: neighboring_top_liege_realm
Child.doc: A realm with a different top liege neighboring the realm of the scope character's top liege; switches to the realm's top title. Can be based on borders a day or two out of date

Child.name: neighboring_top_liege_realm_owner
Child.doc: A realm with a different top liege neighboring the realm of the scope character's top liege; switches to the holder of the realm. Can be based on borders a day or two out of date

Child.name: owned_story
Child.doc: Iterate through all owned stories for a character

Child.name: parent
Child.doc: Iterate through all (both) parents

Child.name: patroned_holy_order
Child.doc: Iterate through all holy orders that the scoped character is a patron of

Child.name: pinned_character
Child.doc: Iterate through characters this player has pinned

Child.name: pinning_character
Child.doc: Iterate through characters whose player has this character pinned

Child.name: player_heir
Child.doc: Iterate through player heirs, capped at the first 10

Child.name: pool_guest
Child.doc: Iterate through all guests visiting the court from the pool (in contrast to foreign_court_guest they don't have a liege)

Child.name: potential_marriage_option
Child.doc: Iterate through all potential selectable marriage or betrohed options

Child.name: pretender_title
Child.doc: Iterate through all landed titles character is pretender to

Child.name: primary_war_enemy
Child.doc: Iterate through all primary war enemies

Child.name: prisoner
Child.doc: Iterate through all prisoners

Child.name: prowess_councillor
Child.doc: Iterate through all prowess-based councillors

Child.name: raid_target
Child.doc: Iterate through anyone the character is hostile to due to having raided them. Only returns top lieges

Child.name: realm_county
Child.doc: Iterate through all counties in the realm. Based on top liege

Child.name: realm_de_jure_duchy
Child.doc: Iterate through all de jure duchies that have at least one county in the realm. Based on top liege

Child.name: realm_de_jure_empire
Child.doc: Iterate through all de jure empire that have at least one county in the realm. Based on top liege

Child.name: realm_de_jure_kingdom
Child.doc: Iterate through all de jure kingdom that have at least one county in the realm. Based on top liege

Child.name: realm_province
Child.doc: Iterate through all realm provinces of a character

Child.name: relation
Child.doc: Iterate through scripted relations of a given type or multiple types, if someone is multiple relations they will only be in the list once

Child.name: scheme
Child.doc: Iterate through all schemes owned by the character

Child.name: secret
Child.doc: Iterate through all secrets of the character

Child.name: sibling
Child.doc: Iterate through all siblings

Child.name: spouse
Child.doc: Iterate through all spouses

Child.name: spouse_candidate
Child.doc: Iterate through all the spouse candidates of a character. WARNING: THIS IS VERY SLOW DO NOT DO IT OFTEN.

Child.name: stewardship_councillor
Child.doc: Iterate through all stewardship-based councillors

Child.name: sub_realm_barony
Child.doc: Iterate through all baronies in sub-realm

Child.name: sub_realm_county
Child.doc: Iterate through all counties in sub-realm

Child.name: sub_realm_duchy
Child.doc: Iterate through all duchies in sub-realm

Child.name: sub_realm_empire
Child.doc: Iterate through all empires in sub-realm

Child.name: sub_realm_kingdom
Child.doc: Iterate through all kingdoms in sub-realm

Child.name: sub_realm_title
Child.doc: Iterate through all titles in sub-realm

Child.name: targeting_faction
Child.doc: Iterate through all factions targeting the scope character

Child.name: targeting_scheme
Child.doc: Iterate through all schemes targeting the character

Child.name: targeting_secret
Child.doc: Iterate through all secrets that target the specified scope

Child.name: traveling_family_member
Child.doc: Iterate though all characters that should travel with the scoped one (when moving between courts for instance); includes the scoped character

Child.name: truce_holder
Child.doc: Iterate through all characters that have a truce on this character

Child.name: truce_target
Child.doc: Iterate through all characters this character has a truce on

Child.name: unspent_known_secret
Child.doc: Iterate through all unspent secrets known by the character

Child.name: vassal
Child.doc: Iterate through all DIRECT vassals

Child.name: vassal_or_below
Child.doc: Iterate through ALL vassals, not just direct vassals

Child.name: war_ally
Child.doc: Iterate through all direct war allies

Child.name: war_enemy
Child.doc: Iterate through all direct war enemies

Child.name: faction_county_member
Child.doc: Iterate through all faction county members

Child.name: faction_member
Child.doc: Iterate through all faction character members

Child.name: war_attacker
Child.doc: Iterate through all attackers in the war

Child.name: war_defender
Child.doc: Iterate through all defenders in the war

Child.name: war_participant
Child.doc: Iterate through all participants in the war

Child.name: defensive_great_holy_wars
Child.doc: Iterate through all great holy wars this faith is defending against

Child.name: faith_holy_order
Child.doc: Iterate through all holy orders of the faith

Child.name: holy_site
Child.doc: Iterate through all holy site baronies of a faith

Child.name: secret_knower
Child.doc: Iterate through all characters who know the secret

Child.name: secret_participant
Child.doc: Iterate through participants in a secret

Child.name: leased_title
Child.doc: Iterate through all titles leased to a holy order

Child.name: activity_declined
Child.doc: Iterate through all characters who declined an activity invite to a specific activity

Child.name: activity_invited
Child.doc: Iterate through all characters who have unanswered invites to a specific activity

Child.name: participant
Child.doc: Iterate through all participants in an activity

Child.name: target_title
Child.doc: Iterate through all casus belli's target titles

Child.name: barony
Child.doc: Iterate through all baronies in the game

Child.name: county
Child.doc: Iterate through all counties in the game

Child.name: county_in_region
Child.doc: Iterate through all counties in the region. Put 'region = region_name' inside it

Child.name: duchy
Child.doc: Iterate through all duchies in the game

Child.name: empire
Child.doc: Iterate through all empires in the game

Child.name: false
Child.doc: true if any child is false (equivalent to NAND)

Child.name: in_global_list
Child.doc: Iterate through all items in global list. list = name or variable = name

Child.name: in_list
Child.doc: Iterate through all items in list. list = name or variable = name

Child.name: in_local_list
Child.doc: Iterate through all items in local list. list = name or variable = name

Child.name: independent_ruler
Child.doc: Independent rulers list with a COUNT tier o above

Child.name: kingdom
Child.doc: Iterate through all kingdoms in the game

Child.name: living_character
Child.doc: Iterate through all living characters

Child.name: player
Child.doc: Iterate through all player characters

Child.name: pool_character
Child.doc: Iterate through all characters in the pool of the given province

Child.name: province
Child.doc: Iterate through all provinces (skips non-land and impassable provinces)

Child.name: religion_global
Child.doc: Iterate through all religions in the game

Child.name: ruler
Child.doc: Rulers list with a COUNT tier o above

Child.name: side_commander
Child.doc: Iterate through all commanders (the commanders of every army on the side, not just the one leading the battle)

Child.name: side_knight
Child.doc: Iterate through all knights

Child.name: pledged_attacker
Child.doc: Iterate through all pledged attackers within a great holy war

Child.name: pledged_defender
Child.doc: Iterate through all pledged defenders within a great holy war
